category: Public Architectural Review Committee Regulations/Article 6 (Appointment of Committee Members)
contents: Article 6 (Appointment of Committee Members) ① Committee members shall be appointed by the Chairman as persons with the following professional qualifications, and the Chairman shall be appointed by the Chairman from among members who are experts in the field of architectural design or architectural planning, but shall obtain the consent of the Board of Directors. 1. A person with practical experience as a domestic or foreign architect or engineer in the relevant field. 2. A person with an assistant professor level or higher in the field of architectural planning, architectural design, urbanism, or landscaping at a university. 3. A person with professional knowledge or practical experience in a field related to public buildings or spatial environments. A person acknowledged by the Chairman to be a member. ② A person who falls under the disqualifications for being an officer pursuant to Article 30, Paragraph 1, Items 2 through 5 and Paragraph 2 of the Articles of Incorporation cannot become a member. ③ Members may concurrently serve as committee members under Articles 40 and 44 of the Articles of Incorporation.
